message.content:
cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.DS, cs.PL, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with regular languages and automata, which are fundamental topics in formal language theory (FL). The focus is on omega-languages, which are infinite words, and their recognition by automata, which falls under the category of logic in computer science (LO). The paper also discusses the expressiveness hierarchy of regular omega-languages, which involves the study of data structures (DS) and programming languages (PL). Finally, the paper touches upon the characterization of languages with a trivial right congruence, which is related to computational complexity (CC).
